xwikidoc.name: ccmArchive20130529
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 29 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <BogdanVancea1_> has joined #ccm 04:12 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 05:50 <kushalkhandelwal> has joined #ccm 06:50 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 08:44 <ravigarg27> hey sdumitriu 09:13 <sdumitriu> Hi 09:18 <sdumitriu> ravigarg27: How's it going? 09:18 <sdumitriu> Time for the daily scrum 09:18 <ravigarg27> umm confused 09:18 <ravigarg27> I looked at the patientsheetcode file today 09:19 <ravigarg27> but couldnt understand it 09:19 <sdumitriu> Hm, it's indeed a bit complex 09:20 <ravigarg27> what I wanted to do is to play with ui parts 09:20 <ravigarg27> insert some elements 09:20 <ravigarg27> etc 09:21 <ravigarg27> I understood that some of the html elements are inserted from the velocity code 09:22 <sdumitriu> Yes 09:23 <ravigarg27> but couldn't find the actual portion from where all the ui element are being deployed 09:24 <ravigarg27> pls help me out! 09:41 <sdumitriu> Hold on, I'll be right back to you 09:41 <ravigarg27> ok 09:57 <sdumitriu> Sorry, I was having breakfast 09:57 <sdumitriu> So 09:58 <sdumitriu> There are many different parts that contribute to the final HTML 09:59 <sdumitriu> The PatientSheetCode content is the one that triggers everything, thouh 09:59 <sdumitriu> though 09:59 <sdumitriu> Mostly with calls to $doc.display (or $obj.display) 10:00 <sdumitriu> $doc and $obj are references to Java objects 10:00 <sdumitriu> $doc is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.java 10:00 <sdumitriu> $obj is https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Object.java 10:01 <sdumitriu> The display calls, if you follow them in Java, will end up either calling one of these classes: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/objects/classes 10:02 <sdumitriu> These output static HTML for editing or viewing properties 10:02 <sdumitriu> These properties are defined in a class 10:03 <sdumitriu> For example, this is the PatientClass holding most of the information about patients: https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/blob/master/components/patient-data/ui/src/main/resources/PhenoTips/PatientClass.xml 10:03 <sdumitriu> Some of the properties have a customDislay, though 10:03 <sdumitriu> For example https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/blob/master/components/patient-data/ui/src/main/resources/PhenoTips/PatientClass.xml#L57-75 10:04 <sdumitriu> When a property has a custom displayer, instead of being displayed using the static methods from the com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes package, the code inside the custom displayer is executed 10:04 <sdumitriu> ravigarg27: With me so far? 10:12 <ravigarg27> sry was out, I got you upto this 10:16 <sdumitriu> OK, so you have to follow the code to see where it goes 10:17 <sdumitriu> Whenever you see a $variable, you can print its class with $variable.class to see what kind of object that is 10:17 <sdumitriu> Then you can go into Java, open that class, and follow the methods 10:18 <ravigarg27> k 10:20 <ravigarg27> also I wanted to ask you one more thing can I work on the ui part first and then on integration with cTAKES 10:22 <sdumitriu> Yes 10:22 <ravigarg27> yeah okay 10:23 <sdumitriu> Want some more easy issues to help you get into the code? 10:26 <ravigarg27> yeah will surely help 10:27 <sdumitriu> https://github.com/compbio-UofT/phenotips/issues/461 10:27 <sdumitriu> This isn't quite easy, more towards medium 10:27 <sdumitriu> But it's a good way of learning how to write components and work with the existing APIs 10:27 <ravigarg27> okay np 10:28 <ravigarg27> k will work on it 11:12 <BogdanVancea> has joined #ccm 12:26 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 13:58 <ravigarg27> has joined #ccm 14:35 <ravigarg27> has left #ccm 17:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 21:50 <phenotips_org> has joined #ccm
